name: outbrag
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to brag (= speak too proudly about something) more than someone else: Their idea of conversation is trying to outbrag each other about their football team's achievements. When I became a doctor, my mother was delighted that she would be able to outbrag her co-workers.
More examplesFewer examplesHe's terrible, always trying to outbrag someone when they start talking about something they have done.She was getting tired of the two guys out-bragging each other in their attempts to make her like them.He was an awful leader who thought that the secret to success was being able to outbrag all your competitors.
